### Prerequisites

### Steps to reproduce

```
PS C:\ProgramData\kasini3000> tcp--ping-v2 fe80::215:5dff:fe15:5910 22
【fe80::215:5dff:fe15:5910】【22】 通了

PS C:\ProgramData\kasini3000> New-PSSession -HostName 'fe80:215:5dff:fe15:5910' -port 22 -UserName root -KeyFilePath 'C:\users\xxx\.ssh\id_rsa'
New-PSSession: One or more computer names are not valid. If you are trying to pass a URI, use the -ConnectionUri parameter, or pass URI objects instead of strings.

New-PSSession -HostName '[fe80:215:5dff:fe15:5910]' -port 22 -UserName root -KeyFilePath 'C:\users\xxx\.ssh\id_rsa'
New-PSSession: One or more computer names are not valid. If you are trying to pass a URI, use the -ConnectionUri parameter, or pass URI objects instead of strings.

PS C:\ProgramData\kasini3000> New-PSSession -HostName '192.168.168.85' -port 22 -UserName root -KeyFilePath 'C:\users\xxx\.ssh\id_rsa'

 Id Name            Transport ComputerName    ComputerType    State         ConfigurationName     Availability
 -- ----            --------- ------------    ------------    -----         -----------------     ------------
  2 Runspace1       SSH       192.168.168.85  RemoteMachine   Opened        DefaultShell             Available

PS C:\ProgramData\kasini3000> invoke-command -ScriptBlock {ip addr } -Session (Get-PSSession)
1: lo: <LOOPBACK,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 65536 qdisc noqueue state UNKNOWN group default qlen 1000
    link/loopback 00:00:00:00:00:00 brd 00:00:00:00:00:00
    inet 127.0.0.1/8 scope host lo
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
    inet6 ::1/128 scope host
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
2: eth0: <BROADCAST,MULTICAST,UP,LOWER_UP> mtu 1500 qdisc mq state UP group default qlen 1000
    link/ether 00:15:12:34:59:09 brd ff:ff:ff:ff:ff:ff
    inet 192.168.168.85/24 brd 192.168.168.255 scope global noprefixroute eth0
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
    inet6 fe80::215:5dff:fe15:5910/64 scope link noprefixroute
       valid_lft forever preferred_lft forever
PS C:\ProgramData\kasini3000>


```

my linux vm has ipv6 ,can be new-pssession by ipv4 normal.

note: 
new-pssession ipv6 to win normal. 
bug or enhancement ? i don't know. choose please.
"-HostName" support 'username@ip:port' ,"Colon" complicates fix?

### Expected behavior

```console
ps session created
```


### Actual behavior

```console
on ps v7.3 preview 7:
New-PSSession: One or more computer names are not valid. If you are trying to pass a URI, use the -ConnectionUri parameter, or pass URI objects instead of strings.
```
